title: Covid Dashboard
description: Webapp that allows users to create visualizations that analyze the spread of Covid based on factors such as location, weather, population, race, daterange, and more
Frontend developed with (functional) React and backend with Flask and SQL(Lite)
Additionally, conducted research to analyze factors contributing to spread of Covid using correlation, association rule mining, hypothesis testing, and Machine Learning

title: Peer List Web App
description: Webapp that allows users to create organizational charts with abilities to add manager, add peer, or add a direct reporter to any given person in the existing chart
Frontend developed with Ember and mock server built with Mirage

title: Movie Genre Predictor
description: Machine learning project developed with another student as a class project that predicts the genre(s) of a movie given keywords, tagline, overview, and other metadata about a movie
Data collected from kaggle and queried from tMDB API, cleaning and exploration done with pandas and matplotlib, and multi-label classification model built with pandas and sklearn

title: Favor Web App
description: A web app developed as a class project with 2 other students that allows users to exchange services using an arbitary virtual currency called "favors"
Web app developed using the Django Framework with HTML, CSS, JS, and jQuery for templating/front-end; wireframes designed with Balsamiq; communication done over Slack
Features include account creation, browsing capabilities, CRUD operations with favor objects, and complex user interactions through exchange of favors

title: Games such as Othello, Minesweeper, 2048, Connect 4, Space Invaders
description: Developed games such as Othello (with option for computer mode and option for showing possible moves), Minesweeper with a resizable grid, Connect 4, 2048, Snake, and Space Invaders (with superpowers and increasing levels of difficulty) in Java
Used the GridWorld Library, Java Swing, and Android Studio to develop GUI

title: Fictional University Wordpress Website
description: A website developed with WordPress with a custom theme, custom post types, and custom functionalities such as search, account creation, favoriting posts, etc.
Content managed with WordPress, communication between the server and client side handled with PHP, CRUD operations performed with AJAX, and frontend developed with Bootstrap, HTML, and Javascript.

title: Meal Credit Sharing app
description: An app that allows Cal Poly students to share their meal credits to those in need of them
Database developed with MySQL, API with Node and Express, and frontend with XCode/Swift and Android Studio/Java
Currently developing a web app with React with Redux for state management
Custom functionalities include account creation, email verification, password recovery, etc.
Secured user information and made a stateless server by storing passwords with hashing and salting mechanism, encrypting (with bcrypt) sensitive data, and using JSON web tokens to represent claims

title: Taco assembly web app
description: A web app developed for a coding challenge that served as a practical introduction to React
Allows users to manage and create custom and (generate) random tacos with ingredients fetched using ClickTime's API

title: KDD Tutorial App
description: A website that covers KDD topics such as decision trees with highly interactive guides that include Q&A, runnable Python Notebooks, and code blocks with copy functionality
Website developed with React; Python notebooks developed with Jupyter; automation scripts made with Python and run with GitHub actions

title: Portfolio Website
description: A personal website built with the objective to learn web development with React (+ other technologies) and create something meaningful in the process
Content managed with Contentful and fetched with Contentful Delivery API, frontend built with React, and website hosted/deployed on GitHub Pages
